result.execSummary:
The defendant Colton D Rodaks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the jail sentence may be served with huber.

miscConds.notes: -Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colton D Rodaks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Deceased - per Agent Kari Stockwell

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 6 months (09/29/2017)

1:10 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Kari Stockwell present in court.  Owes $443.00.  Statement by defendant.  Statement by Agent Stockwell.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for 6 months.  Court informs defendant that if not paid, court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain counsel.

Court adjourned at 1:11 p.m.
Probation review hearing on February 13, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
11:02 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joseph Schuessler.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Schuessler - have received an offer that is acceptable and ready to proceed today.  DA recites agreement - upon plea to the charge, will recommend probation and dismiss repeater.  Atty Schuessler concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1, striking the repeater.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Schuessler.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

90 days county jail, with huber if revoked, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 11:09 a.m.

11:28 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joseph Schuessler present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Schuessler - have received an offer and have not received all the Discovery and requests another hearing.  Court sets for Status Hearing on March 29, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:29 a.m.
No violent contact with Matthew R.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.
No violent contact with Matthew R.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

1:08 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court questions defendant regarding address and employment.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No violent contact with Matthew R.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set for internal review.

Court adjourned at 1:10 p.m.
